metadata.title: CVE-2017-6462 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in the legacy Datum Programmable Time Server (DPTS)refclock driver in NTP before 4.2.8p10 and 4.3.x before 4.3.94 allows localusers to have unspecified impact via a crafted /dev/datum device.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.5
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.5').
